result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota N. Rudd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week and if not then, perform 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakota N. Rudd

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:40 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Possession of THC)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty O'Neill makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 20 days MCJ imposed and STAYED for 6 months probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; DNA sample; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 1 day jail credit if revoked.
